page.title: 02The Town of Dulverton
page.content: Dulverton nestles in a deep bowl surrounded by woods.The name of Dulverton means settlement at the ford in the bend of the river. The town can be divided into three parts_the old medieval part with twisty narrow streets,where all the shops and services are to be found,a second part called Battleton spreading down along the river,a third more modern part,with a council house estate,and other modern houses spreading slightly up out of the valley. The old part is dominated by the church which has a twelfth century tower.Across the River Barle is an old bridge of five arches_an ancient monument.
